jopt.csp.spi.solver
Class ChoicePointStack

java.lang.Object
  jopt.csp.spi.solver.ChoicePointStack
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChoicePointEntryCloseListener
public class ChoicePointStack
extends java.lang.Object
implements ChoicePointEntryCloseListener

The ChoicePointStack object represents a stack that contains the state of a CSP problem at decision points of a searching algorithm. The data contained within the constraint store and domains for all variables can be pushed onto ChoicePointStack by calling the push() method. The data for constraint store and all domains can later be rolled back by calling the pop() method on the stack.

The ChoicePointStack provides this functionality through the creation of ChoicePointDataMap objects. A ChoicePointDataMap is a specialized map object that listens to events generated by the ChoicePointStack. When the stack is pushed, all values in the ChoicePointDataMap are removed. When the stack is popped, the values in the ChoicePointDataMap return to the map. Domains and constraint stores record changes in the map objects that can be undone when a stack is popped.

Searching algorithms call the push method of the ChoicePointStack object before choosing a variable to assign a value. If the value assigned to a variable generates a PropagationFailureException, the search algorithm can pop the stack to roll back changes to the variables in order to try another value or variable. In this way, search algorithms are provided a tool that allows all valid variable / value combinations to be determined.

This class is not thread safe.

Version:
%I%
Author:
Nick Coleman

Method Detail

newNumStackSet

public ChoicePointNumArraySet newNumStackSet(ChoicePointEntryListener listener)
Creates a new ChoicePointNumArraySet associated with this stack. The map will respond to push and pop actions on this stack with a default order to pop of 5.

Parameters:
listener - Object interested in listening for rollback events on map
Returns:
ChoicePointNumArraySet associated with this stack

newNumStackSet

public ChoicePointNumArraySet newNumStackSet(ChoicePointEntryListener listener,
                                             int order)
Creates a new ChoicePointNumArraySet associated with this stack. The list will respond to push and pop actions on this stack. Popping will occur in the order specified.

Parameters:
listener - Object interested in listening for rollback events on stacks
order - Order value indicating at what stage list should be popped
Returns:
ChoicePointNumArraySet associated with this stack

newDataMap

public ChoicePointDataMap newDataMap(ChoicePointEntryListener listener)
Creates a new ChoicePointDataMap associated with this stack and attaches a listener to the map. The map will respond to push and pop actions on this stack and will notify the listener object that a pop action has been initiated allowing data stored in the map to be acted upon before it is discarded.

Parameters:
listener - Object interested in listening for rollback events on map
Returns:
ChoicePointDataMap associated with this stack
See Also:
ChoicePointDataMap

Creates a new ChoicePointDataMap associated with this stack and attaches a listener to the map. The map will respond to push and pop actions on this stack and will notify the listener object that a pop action has been initiated allowing data stored in the map to be acted upon before it is discarded.

Parameters:

Returns:

entryClosedEvent

public void entryClosedEvent(java.lang.Integer entryID)
Closes a ChoicePointEntry associated with this stack. The map will be disconnected from the stack an no more events will be associated with it.

Specified by:
entryClosedEvent in interface ChoicePointEntryCloseListener
Parameters:
entryID - ID of the entry belonging to this stack that should be closed

push

public void push()
Pushes current state of CSP problem onto stack. Called by searching algorithms to record the current state of the constraint store and all domains for a problem before continuing altering a variable to locate a solution. This action can be undone by calling the pop() method.

pushDelta

public void pushDelta(java.lang.Object delta)
Pushes current state of CSP problem onto stack. Called by searching algorithms to record the current state of the constraint store and all domains for a problem before continuing altering a variable to locate a solution. This action can be undone by calling the pop() method.

Parameters:
delta - Delta of changes to push back onto stack

pop

public void pop()

Pops current state of the CSP problem off the stack. Called by searching algorithms to roll back changes to a constraint store and all domains for a problem allowing a problem to return to a previous state before continuing down a different path. The push() method should be called before calling this method.

This method is more efficient to the popDelta method and is encouraged for use if delta information is not necessary

popDelta

public java.lang.Object popDelta()
Pops current state of the CSP problem off the stack. Called by searching algorithms to roll back changes to a constraint store and all domains for a problem allowing a problem to return to a previous state before continuing down a different path. The push() method should be called before calling this method.

Returns:
Delta of changes that has occurred on stack and can be restored by calling push

reset

public void reset()
Resets all data in the choicepoint stack to original values

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
